definitions: baked dish with pastry crust containing sweet or savory filling
circular chart divided into segments showing proportions of data
examples: Grandma's apple pie won first prize at the county fair yesterday
The chicken pot pie made a hearty dinner on the cold night
The pie chart showed that marketing consumed forty percent of budget
Use a pie graph to visualize how time is spent daily

definitions: place where people go for vacations with hotels and recreational facilities
action of turning to something as a final option
examples: The beach resort offered swimming pools restaurants and spa services luxuriously
Ski resorts become crowded during winter holiday seasons every year
Violence should only be used as a last resort for self-defense
They had to resort to borrowing money to pay bills

definitions: money or property left to someone in a will after death
something transmitted by or received from an ancestor or predecessor
examples: Her grandmother's legacy included jewelry and a small savings account
The wealthy philanthropist left a million-dollar legacy to charity
Martin Luther King's legacy continues inspiring civil rights activists today
The company's legacy of innovation spans over fifty years

definitions: extent of the area or subject matter that something deals with
instrument for viewing or examining something not visible to naked eye
examples: The scope of the project expanded beyond our original plans significantly
Understanding the full scope of climate change requires global cooperation
The rifle scope helped hunters see targets at long distances
Doctors used an endoscope to examine the patient's stomach internally

definitions: action of forming or process of being formed into existence
particular arrangement or pattern of people things or parts
examples: Rock formation takes millions of years of geological processes naturally
The formation of new habits requires consistent practice over time
The geese flew south in perfect V formation for efficiency
Military formations marched in precise patterns during the parade ceremony

definitions: father of one's father or mother in family relationships
provision exempting certain people from new regulations based on previous status
examples: My grandfather taught me how to fish when I was young
Both grandfathers attended their granddaughter's wedding ceremony last summer
The grandfather clause allowed existing businesses to avoid new requirements
Voting restrictions often included grandfather clauses historically to discriminate

definitions: feeling or expression of desire for something to happen
request for supernatural fulfillment often associated with magic
examples: Her greatest wish was to see her children succeed happily
I wish you would arrive on time for meetings consistently
The genie granted three wishes to whoever rubbed the lamp
Make a wish before blowing out your birthday candles tonight

definitions: edge or border of something especially on a page
amount by which something is won or falls short
examples: Write your notes in the margin of the textbook pages
The margin between the text and page edge was too narrow
The company operates on very thin profit margins currently
She won the election by a margin of two thousand votes

definitions: injury to living tissue caused by cut blow or other impact
psychological injury caused by emotional trauma or distress
examples: The nurse cleaned and bandaged the wound on his arm carefully
Deep wounds require stitches to heal properly without scarring
The betrayal left emotional wounds that took years to heal
Old wounds reopened when they met after the bitter divorce

definitions: public display of works of art or items of interest
display or demonstration of a particular skill or quality
examples: The art exhibition featured paintings from emerging local artists exclusively
Museum exhibitions change every few months to attract repeat visitors
His temper tantrum was an embarrassing exhibition of poor self-control
The gymnast's exhibition of flexibility amazed the audience completely

definitions: governmental body with the power to make laws for a political unit
branch of government responsible for creating and passing laws
examples: The state legislature meets annually to debate and pass new laws
Members of the legislature represent different districts across the state
The legislature passed the budget after weeks of heated negotiations
Bicameral legislatures have two chambers like senate and house

definitions: painting drawing or photograph of a person especially showing face
detailed description of someone or something in words
examples: The portrait of the company founder hangs in the main lobby
She commissioned a portrait artist to paint her children together
The book provides an intimate portrait of life during wartime
The documentary painted a portrait of urban poverty and resilience

definitions: including a wide variety of things or all-embracing
relating to the Roman Catholic Church or its members
examples: She has catholic tastes in music from classical to hip-hop
His catholic interests ranged from science to poetry and cooking
The Catholic church on Main Street holds mass every Sunday
Catholic schools provide religious education alongside academic subjects

definitions: distinctive clothing worn by members of the same organization
remaining the same in all cases and at all times
examples: Students must wear uniforms to school every day without exception
The police uniform includes a badge gun and radio equipment
The company maintains uniform standards across all store locations globally
Temperature remained uniform throughout the controlled experiment consistently

definitions: extraordinary event attributed to divine intervention defying natural laws
highly improbable or extraordinary event that brings welcome consequences
examples: Many pilgrims visit hoping to witness or experience a miracle
The Bible describes miracles performed by prophets and Jesus Christ
It's a miracle that anyone survived the devastating plane crash
The medical team called her recovery nothing short of a miracle

definitions: physical injury or damage to someone's body or health
material or psychological damage or injury
examples: The medication caused more harm than good with severe side effects
Protect children from harm by childproofing your home thoroughly
Spreading false rumors can harm someone's reputation permanently
No harm was intended by the innocent practical joke

definitions: action or strategy carefully planned to achieve a specific end
method of employing forces in combat or competition
examples: Delaying tactics frustrated negotiations between union and management considerably
The marketing team developed new tactics to reach younger consumers
Military tactics evolved with advances in weapons technology historically
Chess players study tactics to improve their game strategically

definitions: covering for all or part of the face for protection or disguise
manner or expression that hides one's true character or feelings
examples: Everyone wore masks during the pandemic to prevent virus spread
The Halloween mask transformed him into a scary monster instantly
Her cheerful demeanor was a mask hiding deep sadness inside
He couldn't mask his disappointment when he lost the competition

definitions: general increase in prices and fall in purchasing value of money
action of inflating something or the condition of being inflated
examples: Inflation reached eight percent making groceries significantly more expensive annually
Central banks raise interest rates to combat high inflation effectively
Tire inflation should be checked monthly for safety and efficiency
The inflation of the balloon took only a few seconds

definitions: activity of hunting wild animals for food or sport
act of searching determinedly for someone or something
examples: Deer hunting season begins in November and requires proper licenses
Ancient humans relied on hunting for survival before developing agriculture
Job hunting can be stressful and time-consuming for recent graduates
The police are hunting for clues in the mysterious disappearance

definitions: last examination in a course of study at school or college
last game in a sports tournament that decides the winner
examples: She studied all night preparing for her chemistry final exam
Final exams count for forty percent of the course grade
The World Cup final attracted over a billion television viewers
Our team made it to the finals but lost in overtime

definitions: soft substance of human or animal body consisting of muscle and fat
soft edible part of a fruit or vegetable
examples: The wound cut deep into the flesh requiring immediate medical attention
Flesh-eating bacteria can cause severe infections if untreated quickly
The flesh of the peach was sweet and juicy perfectly ripe
Avocado flesh turns brown when exposed to air too long

definitions: man or boy in informal usage often showing familiarity
member of a learned society or professional organization
examples: That fellow over there asked for directions to the station
He's a good fellow who always helps his neighbors willingly
She was elected a fellow of the Royal Society last year
Research fellows at the university receive funding for their projects

definitions: fiber transmitting impulses between brain or spinal cord and body parts
confidence courage or audacity especially in challenging situations
examples: The damaged nerve caused numbness in her left hand permanently
Nerve cells transmit electrical signals throughout the body constantly
It takes nerve to speak in front of large audiences confidently
He had the nerve to ask for a raise after arriving late

definitions: pair of organs in the chest that supply body with oxygen
essential respiratory organ that exchanges oxygen and carbon dioxide
examples: Smoking damages lung tissue and increases cancer risk significantly
The doctor listened to her lungs with a stethoscope carefully
Deep breathing exercises help expand lung capacity over time naturally
Lung transplants can save lives of patients with severe disease

definitions: heading at the top of an article or page in newspaper
person or thing that is the main attraction
examples: The scandal made headlines in newspapers around the world instantly
Editors write compelling headlines to attract readers' attention quickly
The famous singer will headline the music festival this summer
Comedy acts headline at the club every Friday night regularly

definitions: person accused or sued in a court of law
party against whom a lawsuit is brought in legal proceedings
examples: The defendant pleaded not guilty to all charges against him
Defendants have the right to legal representation in criminal cases
Multiple defendants were named in the class action lawsuit together
The defendant's lawyer argued for dismissal of the case

definitions: long slender piece of wood or metal used as support
either extremity of earth's axis north pole or south pole
examples: The flag flew from a tall pole in front of the building
Utility poles carry electrical wires above the streets safely
Penguins live near the south pole in Antarctica year-round
Magnetic poles affect compass navigation for ships and planes

definitions: opening such as door or gate allowing access to a place
act of entering or coming onto a stage or into view
examples: The main entrance to the building faces the parking lot directly
Security guards check identification at every entrance point carefully
The bride's entrance brought tears to many guests' eyes
The actor made a dramatic entrance wearing a flowing cape

definitions: vehicle capable of flight such as airplane or helicopter
any machine capable of flying through air under control
examples: Commercial aircraft carry millions of passengers annually around the world
Military aircraft include fighters bombers and transport planes specifically
Small aircraft are popular for private pilots and flight training
The aircraft manufacturer announced a new fuel-efficient model yesterday

definitions: cupboard with shelves or drawers for storing or displaying items
group of senior government ministers representing executive branch
examples: She stored dishes in the kitchen cabinet above the sink
The medicine cabinet in the bathroom needs child-proof locks
The president appointed new members to his cabinet yesterday
Cabinet meetings discuss important policy decisions every week

definitions: state of being happy showing pleasure or contentment
feeling of satisfaction with life and positive emotional well-being
examples: Her face radiated happiness when she saw her grandchildren arrive
Money cannot buy true happiness according to many philosophers
The pursuit of happiness is mentioned in the Declaration of Independence
Happiness levels vary across different cultures and economic conditions

definitions: process or fact of entering or being allowed to enter
statement acknowledging the truth of something often reluctantly
examples: College admission decisions arrive in March for most students anxiously
The museum charges twenty dollars for admission on weekends
His admission of guilt came after hours of police questioning
The admission that they were wrong took courage to make

definitions: statistical measure showing how two variables change together systematically
mutual relationship or connection between two or more things
examples: Researchers found a strong correlation between exercise and mental health
The correlation coefficient measures the strength of the relationship mathematically
There's a clear correlation between education level and income generally
Scientists study correlations to understand cause and effect relationships

definitions: part share or number considered in comparative relation to whole
correct attractive or ideal relationship in size between things
examples: A large proportion of students rely on financial aid for college
The proportion of women in leadership roles has increased recently
The artist carefully considered proportion when designing the sculpture
The building's proportions create a sense of harmony and balance

definitions: disagreement or argument about something important between parties
formal discussion of opposing views especially in legal contexts
examples: The neighbors had a dispute over the property line location
Labor disputes can lead to strikes if not resolved quickly
The territorial dispute between the countries lasted for decades
They settled the dispute through mediation rather than court

definitions: sweet food made with sugar or chocolate eaten as snack
confectionery products collectively especially those high in sugar
examples: Halloween trick-or-treaters collected bags full of candy enthusiastically
The candy store displayed colorful sweets in glass jars
Too much candy can cause tooth decay and health problems
She keeps candy in her desk drawer for afternoon cravings

definitions: thing given in recognition of service effort or achievement
money offered for information about a crime or criminal
examples: Hard work brings its own rewards beyond just monetary compensation
The company offers rewards for employees who exceed sales targets
Police posted a reward for information leading to the suspect's arrest
The reward for finding the lost dog was five hundred dollars

definitions: person trained to give guidance on personal or psychological problems
person who supervises children at a summer camp
examples: The school counselor helped students with college applications and planning
Marriage counselors work with couples to resolve relationship conflicts
Summer camp counselors organize activities and ensure children's safety
She worked as a counselor at the day camp during vacation

definitions: sound or moving images that have been preserved electronically
action or process of capturing sound images or data
examples: The band's latest recording topped the music charts nationally
Old recordings preserve voices of people long since passed away
Recording the meeting helps ensure accurate minutes later
The recording equipment malfunctioned during the important interview unfortunately

definitions: heap of things laid or lying one on top of another
heavy post driven into ground to support a structure
examples: A pile of dirty laundry sat in the corner waiting
She sorted through piles of paperwork on her cluttered desk
Construction crews drove piles deep into the soft ground first
The bridge rests on concrete piles sunk into the riverbed

definitions: violent shattering or blowing apart of something with noise
sudden dramatic increase in amount or extent of something
examples: The gas explosion destroyed three houses and injured five people
Witnesses heard the explosion from miles away last night
The population explosion strained resources in developing countries significantly
An explosion of interest in yoga occurred during recent years

definitions: upholstered furniture for seating multiple people in living spaces
furniture used in psychotherapy where patients recline
examples: The family gathered on the couch to watch movies together
We need a new couch because this one is falling apart
The patient lay on the therapist's couch discussing childhood memories
Freud's couch became a symbol of psychoanalysis over time

definitions: movable articles used to make a room suitable for living or working
large movable equipment used in homes offices or other spaces
examples: They bought new furniture when they moved into their house
Antique furniture can be valuable if properly maintained and authenticated
Office furniture includes desks chairs and filing cabinets typically
The furniture store offers free delivery on large purchases

definitions: quality of being worthy of attention or importance
extent to which a result deviates from that expected by chance
examples: The historical significance of the discovery cannot be overstated
She didn't understand the significance of his words until later
The results showed statistical significance at the 0.05 level
Researchers must demonstrate significance before publishing their findings

definitions: power of apparently influencing events by using mysterious forces
art of producing illusions as entertainment by sleight of hand
examples: Children believe in magic and fairy tales naturally when young
Ancient cultures used magic rituals to influence natural events
The magic show amazed audiences with impossible seeming tricks nightly
Learning magic tricks requires practice and manual dexterity

definitions: person appointed to a role with particular administrative authority
head of a professional sports league or organization
examples: The police commissioner announced new community policing initiatives yesterday
County commissioners voted on the new budget proposals last night
The baseball commissioner suspended players for violating league rules
She served as commissioner of the basketball league successfully

definitions: flat horizontal surface fixed to wall or frame for storage
submarine bank or part of continental margin
examples: Books lined every shelf from floor to ceiling impressively
The top shelf held grandmother's special china collection safely
The continental shelf extends miles from the shoreline underwater
Oil drilling occurs on the ocean shelf in many locations

definitions: brave or experienced soldier or fighter especially in former times
person who shows great vigor courage or aggressiveness
examples: Ancient warriors trained from childhood in combat skills rigorously
The tribal warrior defended his people against invading forces
She's a warrior on the basketball court never giving up
Cancer survivors often call themselves warriors against the disease

definitions: science dealing with matter energy motion and force
physical properties and phenomena of something
examples: Physics class covered topics from mechanics to quantum theory comprehensively
Einstein revolutionized physics with his theory of relativity
The physics of flight explains how airplanes stay airborne
Understanding the physics of the problem helps find solutions
